resources.string:
This application does not provide medical advice. It is a tool for use by physicians who seek information to help them diagnose and treat their patients. Only physicians should use this application. This application does not provide diagnoses or treatment recommendations of any kind.

The contents of this application, such as text, graphics, images, information, and other material contained in the application (\"Content\") are for informational purposes only. The Content is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, judgment, diagnosis, or treatment. The Content is intended to provide physicians information to consider in using their medical judgment.

Patients should always seek the advice of a physician or other qualified health provider with any questions they may have regarding medical conditions.

ZOLL makes no warranty, express or implied, regarding the performance, accuracy or clinical value of this application. This application and the information it generates are provided “AS IS”. Without limitation ZOLL specifically disclaims any warranty of merchantability or fitness for any particular purpose.

To use the Post-PCI Sudden Cardiac Arrest Risk Calculator, select \'Start\' and you will be asked to answer a series of questions that will assess a patient\'s risk profile. The information you enter will be used to determine the patient\'s risk status.
This patient is at <u>Low</u> risk of mortality, particularly in the early period post-PCI based on the risk factors identified:
This patient is at <u>Elevated</u> risk of mortality, particularly in the early period post-PCI based on the risk factors identified:
This patient is at <u>High</u> risk of mortality, particularly in the early period post-PCI based on the risk factors identified:

1 Halkin A, Singh M, Nikolsky N, et al. Prediction of Mortality After Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for Acute Myocardial Infarction: The CADILLAC Risk Score. JACC 2005;45:1397-1405.

2 Weintraub W, Grau-Sepulveda M, Weiss J, et al. Prediction of Long-Term Mortality After Percutaneous Coronary Intervention in Older Adults: Results From the National Cardiovascular Data Registry. Circulation 2012;125:1501-1510.

3 Solomon SD, Zelenkofske S, McMurray JV, et al. Sudden Death in Patients with Myocardial Infarction and Left Ventricular Dysfunction, Heart Failure, or Both. NEJM 2005;352:2581-2588.

4 Zishiri ET, Williams S, Cronin EM. Early Risk of Mortality after Coronary Artery Revascularization in Patients with Left Ventricular Dysfunction and Potential Role of the Wearable Cardioverter Defibrillator. Circulation: Arrhythmia and Electrophysiology. 2013;6: 117-128.

5 Adabag AS, Therneau TM, Gersh BJ, et al. Sudden Death After Myocardial Infarction. JAMA 2008;300(17):2022-2029.

6 Buxton AE, Lee KL, Hafley GE, et al. Limitations of Ejection Fraction for Prediction of Sudden Death Risk in Patients with Coronary Artery Disease: Lessons From the MUSTT Study. J. Am. Coll. Cardiol. 2007;50;1150-1157.

7 Stone G, Rao SV, Hermiller JB, et al. “Prevention of Sudden Cardiac Arrest Post PTCA in High-Risk Patients.” April 2011. Available at http://www.theheart.org/article/1202823.do
